meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Rugged Course Shakes Up the Leader Board Phil Mickelson, standing at left, stuck in the rough at Oakmont Country Club, missed the cut yesterday at the United States Open. Ángel Cabrera, who has never won a PGA Tour event, was the leader after two rounds.
Brutal Work at China's Kilns News reports of forced labor at a northern province's brick kilns have swept China in an unfolding scandal that involves the kidnapping of hundreds of children.
The Great Wide Classroom Eighth graders from Newark, whose playground is a paved courtyard, spend three days at a Catskill camp in a last hurrah before high school.
The Luckiest People Barbra Streisand is touring Europe with New York freelance musicians, who get a plum job. And the tour is also good news for musicians left behind.

Groups Rallied to Revive Immigration Legislation After a comprehensive immigration bill was pulled from the Senate floor, advocates rallied behind it. Within 24 hours, the Roman Catholic Church and many business, labor and Hispanic groups were urging the Senate to resurrect it. While they had all complained about various provisions of the measure, they did not want it to die.
Gas Prices Up; Wages Down Americans faced higher gas prices and eroding wages last month, even as an important gauge of inflation drifted lower, a government report said.
Mets Beat Yanks and Clemens Roger Clemens pitched well, but Oliver Pérez was even better last night as the Mets defeated the Yankees, 2-0.
Killing Pain or Selling Drugs? Pain is hard to measure, and those who treat it have to make subjective decisions about dosage levels. When a doctor gets it wrong, is it a mistake or a felony?
Not in My Front Yard On West 15th Street, a new condo with a terrace over the building next door is drawing fire.

Rugged Course Shakes Up the Leader Board Phil Mickelson, standing at left, stuck in the rough at Oakmont Country Club, missed the cut yesterday at the United States Open. Ángel Cabrera, who has never won a PGA Tour event, was the leader after two rounds.

The Great Wide Classroom Eighth graders from Newark, whose playground is a paved courtyard, spend three days at a Catskill camp in a last hurrah before high school.
The Luckiest People Barbra Streisand is touring Europe with New York freelance musicians, who get a plum job. And the tour is also good news for musicians left behind.

Groups Rallied to Revive Immigration Legislation After a comprehensive immigration bill was pulled from the Senate floor, advocates rallied behind it. Within 24 hours, the Roman Catholic Church and many business, labor and Hispanic groups were urging the Senate to resurrect it. While they had all complained about various provisions of the measure, they did not want it to die.
Gas Prices Up; Wages Down Americans faced higher gas prices and eroding wages last month, even as an important gauge of inflation drifted lower, a government report said.
Mets Beat Yanks and Clemens Roger Clemens pitched well, but Oliver Pérez was even better last night as the Mets defeated the Yankees, 2-0.
Killing Pain or Selling Drugs? Pain is hard to measure, and those who treat it have to make subjective decisions about dosage levels. When a doctor gets it wrong, is it a mistake or a felony?
Not in My Front Yard On West 15th Street, a new condo with a terrace over the building next door is drawing fire.
